sub_title: MD, PhD | Resident Internal Medicine (AIOS) | Researcher | Team Learning - Interdisciplinary Teams, Psychological Safety & Leadership |
summary:
Medical doctor, currently working as resident Internal Medicine at Zuyderland MC but based at Maastricht University Medical Centre, the Netherlands. I'm passionate about workplace learning of health professionals, especially regarding coaching, teamwork and leadership skills. 
I have 10 years of dedicated experience in (PhD)student representation and participated in local and (inter)national (accreditation) boards on the improvement of medical education. 
Also, I have been the principal researcher for studies ranging from student participation and mentoring (as a student), to team learning and leadership (as a PhD candidate). Currently, I am involved in studies on team cohesion, collaborative learning and organizational drivers for learning. I take a multidisciplinary approach, using knowledge from management sciences, organizational psychology, educational sciences and health care, and conduct mainly qualitative methods (e.g. interviews, focus groups, observations, document analysis, ethnography). 
I co-developed a leadership profile in the Master of Health Professions Education (MHPE) curriculum renewal at Maastricht University, and a leadership development programme for course coordinators at the same university. I am a teacher, coach and thesis supervisor in Medicine and MHPE, and co-promotor in health professions education research.
I hope to emerge as a young clinician, mentor and health professions researcher who studies teams, leadership and organizational cultures, a field that I believe is complex, but has a lot to offer health professions in the workplace. 

My strong traits: communication and leadership incl. strong interpersonal skills, coaching skills, presentation skills, organising skills.

awards.title: Marijke Sterman prijs
awards.description:
'De prijs is vernoemd naar misschien wel de meest bekende persoon van de NVMO: Marijke Sterman. De prijs wordt uitgereikt aan een promovendus die belichaamt waar Marijke voor staat. De promovendus is: 
Naast het eigen promotieonderzoek betrokken bij de maatschappij in een bredere sociale context; 

Altruïstisch en staat klaar voor collega’s in het medisch onderwijs; of 

Binnen en buiten het promotieonderzoek een belangrijke verbindende schakel tussen mensen.'

awards.title: Beurs Dr. Catherine van Tussenbroekfonds
awards.description:
In 1926 werd het Dr. Catharine van Tussenbroek Fonds opgericht als eerbetoon aan de naamgeefster, een arts en feministe van het eerste uur. De initiatiefnemers wilden met het fonds de wetenschappelijke ontplooiing van vrouwen bevorderen. Het Catharine van Tussenbroek Fonds richt zich op steun aan vrouwelijke onderzoekers tijdens hun promotieonderzoek en in de post-doctorale fase die in het buitenland zelfstandig onderzoek willen doen.

https://www.cvtfonds.nl/

profile_positions.title: Visiting Scholar

profile_positions.description:
I study teams in the development of integrated health professions education. These teams consist of medical educators, originating from different domains. I aim to support people who manage, lead and work in interdisciplinary teams, to ultimately improve the implementation of integrated education. Team learning, leadership & psychological safety are key concepts in my research.

During my PhD, I also fulfilled roles as mentor, university teacher, speaker, debate leader, international conference organizer & representative of my peer group.

Main awards:
- Nominee Doctoral Report Award Nederlandse Vereniging Medisch Onderwijs (NVMO)
- 2nd Place Doctoral Report Award Association for Medical Education in Europe (AMEE) 2022
- Junior Investigator Award American Educational Research Association (AERA) 2021

PhD Defense 12-11-'21
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate, Educational Development & Research, School of Health Professions Education (SHE)

profile_positions.description:
1. Member of the SHE management team research 

2. Member of the Faculty PhD Committee (FPC) of FHML. The FPC advises the Board about the broad domain of PhD related issues. The committee is also a platform for the exchange of knowledge and experiences and the discussion of relevant developments and operational issues within and between Schools/Institutes.
Besides general PhD related issues, the FPC has attention for monitoring, supervision and education of PhD students.

https://www.maastrichtuniversity.nl/about-um/faculties/health-medicine-and-life-sciences/phd-fhmlmumc/faculty-phd-committee-fpc

profile_positions.description: The Maastricht UMC+ Research Committee (WMUMC+) is an independent advisory body working on behalf of the Maastricht UMC+ Board. The advice, both requested and volunteered, has both policy and operational elements. The operational tasks consist of, among others, advising on the subject of structural and development reports, the ‘Kootstra Talent Fellowship’, the NWO Innovational Research Incentives Scheme and ZonMw Efficiency Study applications.
